text:
It is my understanding that Category and Priority is to be deprecated for Logger
and Level classes.

Due to the fact that Logger inherits most of its functionality from the Category
class, some of its methods like isEnabledFor requires a Priority instance as
parameter.  Any attempt to pass a Level do not compile.

Must all Logger methods not use Level classes instead of Priority?
creator: alwyn@smart.com.ph
ceki@apache.org
text:
A Level instance *is* a Priority instance. So, I would very much doubt that 
passing a Level instead of Priority will not compile. 

It looks more like a support issue than a bug. I am closing your bug report as 
WORKSFORME.

I must apologize. The cause of the problem was a clash with a Logger class in
the same directory.
creator: alwyn@smart.com.ph
ceki@apache.org
text:
Alwyn,

No harm done. Thanks for letting us know.
